comments:
Build ID: I20070323-1616

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Build without compile error's.
2. Start "Clean Up" your project.
3. Await the error Message

More information:
My Project contains 2.641 Java-Files.
After more than 300 files cleaned occourse the Message: 
"A fatal error occurred while performing the refactoring." in "Clean Up Wizard Dialog". 

My Computer: 
WinXP Pro, P4 @ 2.20 GHz
Ram: 760 MB - Swapfile: 1140 MB

Eclipse: 512 MB Ram

All those java-files are POJO's without any use of reflection.
Also the source was compiled by "java sdk 1.4_12".
After that, i hit the cancel button and inspect the Exception:

I start eclipse using a quicklink in the windows-start-bar.
The target:
C:\Programme\eclipse336\eclipse.exe  -vmargs -Xms512m -Xmx512m

I can't reproduce it. 
Do you use plain eclipse SDK or do you have additional plugins installed?
If yes, does it also happen without the plugins?
Does it happen every time? 
What if you start up eclipse and then run clean up right away? Does it still happen? 
Does it happen if you increase memory 1024MB? 
Which clean ups do you have enabled? 
Can I get a hand on the project on which this happen (is it OSS)?

Thanks
We need more info here. Please reopen if you have.
